text: Bottle from Rudat.  Very smooth and fragile aroma. Hints of fruity fresh melon. Easy to drink, not much alcohol. Great depth of the aroma, fruit, pears, fresh cut yellow fruit. Great moderate long aftertaste, refreshing and round. Fantastic fragile Sake!
Bottle sample at a tasting at Naamas place. Thanks Naama. As Yamahai Muroka Junmai-Shu Sake. Aroma of berry-flavored candy, citrus. Sweetish flavor with rice, a light tart hint, fruitiness.
From bottle @ Nøgne Ø-smagning, Aalborg. Aroma of apples, alcohol. Clear, slight colour. Taste is some fruit, alcohol. Full body, smooth feel, light sweet, but alcohol finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen. (Nøgne Ø Takeover 24/06/2015). Pours clear yellow with no head. Aroma and taste is fruits, rice, pear, alcohol. Flat carbonation. Watery. Sweet finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (Nøgne Ø Takeover 24/06/2015) - crystal clear white yellow colour with no head. Aroma and taste is one of fruits, almost melon or pear like, rice, very sweet overt boozy, not really one for me this.

Draught at Taphouse. No head. Clear thin looking yellow water like body. Mild and week fruity sweet aroma. Sweet and yet dusty fruity flavor with notes of sweet apples. Low carbonation, long sweet finish. Alcohol nicely hidden by the sweetness.

24-JUN-2015, draft @Taphouse.
Watery, no head.
Aroma is sweet with alcohol. Taste the same. Rice, a Little fruit. Simple. Watery but still sugary - though dry. I am really no Expert on Sake.
From tap at Taphouse. Clear golden colour without a head. Aroma and flavour of rice, fruit and alcohol.

Bottle 0.350l at home, Oulu. Batch #006. Bottled on: 05.10.2010. Colour is clear yellow with no head. Aromas and flavours: Hints of fruits, citrus, grain, yeast and rice. Too old bottle and very unenjoyable.

06.11.2014, 0,375l bottle (batch #1) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Light straw colored, slightly unclear. Aroma is mild and slightly sour-ish mineraly, fermented rice, hay, minerals, yeast, grass. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, hay, minerals, fermented rice, alcohol, paper, hints of sour-ish fruits. Slightly dry and watery mouthfeel, nice warming alcohol. Fair enough.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2014.
Appearance: Pale colour, no head.
Aroma: Fruit, rice, alcohol.
Body: Medium body, no carbonation. Oily mouthfeel.
Flavour: Rice, alcohol, some fruit.

330 ml bottle at home. Pours like a light white sevre & maine wine. Wine aroma full of subtle fruit touches: lychee, pineapple, peach and mango. Light body, saled, dry finish. Again white wine touches in the taste
 This is actually very nice, but wondering why it is categorised under beer... it is closer to wine

Bottle at Craigs since he noticed I enjoy sake, I didnt know any breweries also dabbled in this game. Pours yellowish clear. Nose is light fruit and grass. tastes of grass, coconut, honey dew, slight butter. Thin palate
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear pale yellow. Aromas of light pineapple and alcohol. Taste is sake. Not really my thing.

Clear light straw color, no head. Grass and floral nose, yeast, alcohol, fruity notes of melon and apple, rice, cellar, quite sharp. Light sweet and fruity taste, melon, minerals. Medium body, oily texture, no carbonation.
Hvitvinsfarget. lukter av grønne epler, gjær og syrlig. Smaken er ganske så fruktig. vinøs og tørr avslutning.
Blank, fruktig, grønt eple og melonlukt. Smaker tørrhvitvin, men likevel fruktig.
Klar lys hvitvinsfarve. Lukt av pære, eple og annen frukt samt gjær. Smak av frukter og sopp. Vinøs avslutning. Vinmonopolet.
Duft av Pære, gjær og alkohol. Fin klar lys hvitvin farge. Ingen skum. Smak av pære, mango og alkohol.
Bottle at home. Pale yellow, earthy nose, light fruit, taste is thin, sweet, light pineapple and coconut.

350ml bottle, as Yamahai Muroka Junmai-Shu Sake, from Vinmonopolet Bestillingsutvalget, shared with Finn at his place. Clear pale straw coloured body. Naked surface. Aroma of bread, pears and alcohol. Sweet and tart flavours with notes of pear, apple, and yeast. Dry and sweet ending. Gets very sweet. Hard to evaluate. Anyway, quite alright (Tromsø 27.05.2014).
[5358-20130510] Bottle. Light floral rice aroma. Clear, light green yellow body with no lasting head. More rice floral gin in the flavour. Light-medium body. Tasty. (7/3/7/3/13) 3.3
Min første ratede sake .Flaske fra esp0r på nyttårsaften. Vannfarget. Smaker en blanding av gjær og tam hvithvin.
Quite pale. Smell of bakers yeast, rice and alcohol. Moderate sweet, fruity, quite yeasty. Not my cup of sake...

This is my first sake! Aroma is the weakest point, but perhaps this is characteristic for sake? Looks great in the glass - like white wine. I like the taste, its more "powerful" than with wine. Smooth mouth-feel. Overall a good drinking-experience. In "Kill Bill" they have warm sake - is that better? I drink it out from the fridge.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 5/VIII/13 - bottle @ Klaas place - BB: n/a (2013-693) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear little off-white fluid. Aroma: banana, bit cheesy, dairy, white spirit, bit sugary. MF: light body. Taste: green banana, fruity, bit sweet, cheesy, yuzu. Aftertaste: dairy, herbal, bay leaf, lime, bit lemony, more banana, cheese. Weird. But then again, this is my first Sake...

Bottle 0,350l. Pours a straw colour. Aroma of melon, coconut, alcohol and rice. Same for taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

thnx to bobochamp
pours very clear ( like vodka) . no foam ( wioch is a shock ... ) 

no smell 
taste is alcoholic . as my second sake , i can not realy compare. but this doenst realy taste. its like a mellow vodka ...
Nice white wine appearance. Aroma is rice, alcohol, fruity, bread and cheap white wine. Full body with alot of bread. aftertaste is fruit, alcohol and more bread. Overall: Hard to rate this.

Appearance: Light yellow color with no head.Aroma: Yeast, rice, and mild fruity.Palate: Medium body. Mild sweetness and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Yeast, alcohol, rice, some spices and mild fruity.Overall impression: I would not belive it if you told me, but Im starting to like sake. This was very pleasant and mild. Not the disturbing rough yeast and alcohol stuff.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Oslo - Vika in Oslo, Norway.

35 cl bottle @ olio. Batch #009, bottled 11.11.2011
Cold:
Aroma has footsweat, spices, wheat, rice, green apples, booze and sweet bready notes (ryemill bread to be exact.) Flavour is sweet with pear esthers, footsweat, green apples and rice. Burning alcohol in the finish. 
Warm:
Aroma is close to cows breath with booze and rice. More fruity and more rice notes, but then again booze comes too much through. Also gluey notes are stronger.

35 cl bottle.
Pours clear pale golden color with no head. Aroma of apple, some ryemeal bread yeast and spices. Flavor of apples, pear, some grass, white wine and yeast. Pleasant.
4224

330 ml bottle.
Pours a clear bright yellow colour without a head. Aroma of dough-like yeast, turnip and some grass. Flavour of green apples, turnip, grass, fennel and alcohol. Alcohol comes through quite a lot. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel, low carbonation and an apple, turnip and a bit spicy finish. Sake is still not my thing.

350ml bottle from Alko Arkadia

Pours clear light yellow with no head. Aroma of alcohol, stingy pear, apples and spices. Taste of stingy apples, pear, alcohol, spices. Finish is vinous and strong with alcohol, pear, apples and stingy fruits. Im not a huge fan of sakes but this one was decent.

It pours greenish yellow with a slight haziness. The aroma has notes of: pears, rice-pudding, and earthy mushrooms. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium bitter and tart; there are notes of: green bell peppers, peppercorns, alcohol, shitake, and a light pear. The palate is medium-full bodied, slick, with a long finish. Overall, I was flabbergasted when I realized this was a Nøgne Ø product - yet Im impressed with their work.

Served up into my backup glass @ The-Fest in Woosta. 

Body is blank, if slightly yellowed from the house lighting.

Pears, starch, & faint flowers on the nose.

Taste faintly of banana & iced down Seven-up sweetness. Slight slickness. Low acid. Little tweak of alcohol burn.  

Not very familiar with rating sake, but this one just seemed a bit too subtle.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: The first time I ever tried sake. Drank it alongside a tuna dish, with the sake also in a soya sauce-oil-mix alongside. A really nice experience

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Hazy, green/yellow liquid. Aroma of pears, apples, booze, rice and tropical fruit. Taste is dry and light boozy with lots of peary notes. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Nice.

Bottle: Pale with residue. Nose has cantaloupe, melons, slight apples, fruity rice. A bit mellow, neutral. Body is a bit slick, with rice, apples and slight fruityness. A nice, standard, although flavourful, sake. A bit short and without anything really standing out, but well made and all that.
Stockholm Beer & Whiskey 2012: Stora "kola" toner, ganska het men ändå frisk. Eftersmaken er lite torr

Sample at SBWF 2012, Master Class with Kjetil Jikiun.

Clear, almost like water. No head. Aroma and taste of rice, toffee, apples and some alcohol. Rather short aftertaste.
A tiny bit unclear white/yellow. Yeast, rice and fruity nose.Wineous aromas. Alcohol. Rice. Fruity.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 Pours like white wine. Nose of apple and fruit. Aroma of apple, fruit, alcohol.
I didnt like this one that much (my first sake)

Sample from bottle at Bishops Arms, Vasagatan, Stockholm. Very pale green/yellow color, no head. Melon and pear aroma, apples and alcohol. 
Melon flavor, apples, hay, of course quite a lot of alcohol. I dont really know how to relate to this.

On tap @ Pingvinen, Bergen. Pours light yellow, completely without head. Aroma is acidic with fruit and yeast. Some oak and alcohol, and an almost vinous feel, except for the light, almost watery body. Flavour is on the sweet side, with apples and yeast.

My first sake. Aroma of apple, alcohol, white wine and rice. Very pale yellow colour. Taste is much like white wine, but more sticky, with notes of apple and rice. Nice as a apertif for an beer-tasting evening.

Pouring at The Festival in Worcester.  Pours a clear yellow straw color.  Warm sweet rice, melon and fruit on the nose.  Melon, with a touch of smoke, soft rice, sweet caramel.  Warm and smooth, long warmth.  Tasty and subtle.  Melon and rice on the finish.  Nice change of pace during a beer fest.

Bottle poured at THE FESTIVAL with Andrew. Pours a clear water body with no head, some carbonated lacing. Aroma is sweet rice, spice, earth and alcohol. Mouthfeel is moderate to thick with light carbonation and notes of alcohol, sweet fruit and rice.

1200th rate and first ever sake!  350ml bottle.  Pours a very pale yellow with no head.  Aroma is alcohol, burnt plastic, apple and white wine.  Taste has coconut and plastic to start.  Rice and alcohol in the finish.  Full in the mouth to start with a watery finish.  Warming.

This is impossible. How on earth am I supposed to rate a sake? Ive had this bottle and another sake in my refrigerator for weeks, Ive smelled, tasted, compared, made notes but I still havent managed to come up with something clever to say about them. And now I guess the bottles have been opened for too long. But Ill try: the body is clear with a noticeable greenish tint. The aroma is bakers yeast and some unidentified fully ripe, fruity notes. The taste is quite sweet and light acidic. Flavours are bakers yeast, rice (I guess) and fruits. The body is not as light as other sakes Ive had. So, a quite good sake, I think. 
[35 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Grønland, Oslo]
In bottle. Pours a straw colour with a lovely aroma of melon, coconut, alcohol and rice. Delicious melon and coconut flavours again with lingering alcohol. Nice.
@ Copenhagen festival 2011.  The aroma has white wine. Almost looks like water, just a little colour there. No head. The taste is watery, has white wine, rice, alcohol. Very thin. Not my thing.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: served in a full wineglass for some reason, slightly hazy lemon/green with no head, tastes mostly like lemon drops, rice (sake), slight herbs, lemon drops/herbal sweet, sake yeast, slight young, green apples, bit wattery, moderate to light alcohol for a sake, it is manageable/ok //// sampled again from a bottle, hasnt changed my opinion or rating.

Rating #150, and my first sake ever! Which means Ill have no idea what Ill be talking about here. I got the bottle from a local "Vinmonopol". Batch #006, bottled 05.10.2010, which incidentally means that it was bottled exactly one year ago today (I write this after midnight, so technically its October 6th, but in my mind its still the 5th)!

Beautiful bottle, beautiful label, quite fulfilling for my slightly japanophile side. The bottle has been refridgerated for some days.

So I open the bottle, and pour a bit into a wine glass, since I dont have anything more appropriate for a sake. My cat is curiously watching. There is no carbonation, Im pretty sure that is normal. To me it looks like a white wine. The colour is a very pale yellow.

Aroma: Alcohol and... fruity rice. I think thats the best way I can describe it. At first I get tiny flashbacks to high school and locally produced moonshine, but that quickly passes as I pay more attention. The fruitiness I can only describe as green apples, without the sourness. Smells pretty "fresh", like perhaps the smell of an early morning after a heavy rain, a short distance from the fruit garden of a japanese zen temple, if such temples have fruit gardens. 

Taste and palate: Interesting! Different from anything Ive ever tasted. Rather slick/oily mouthfeel. The alcohol is quite present, from start to finish. The flavors start out fruity (the aforementioned green apple flavor) and something else I cant describe. Then, very smoothly, it glides into a very nutty finish (or is it more woody? Im not sure), and I can definitely tell that this has been made with rice. Fruity hints in the finish as well. Slight alcohol burn as I swallow.

Since Ive never had a sake before, Ive got nothing to compare this to, but I must say that I do enjoy this! Theres a strange taste up front which I cant really describe, but it seems connected to the green apple flavor. The mouthfeel is also rather "foreign" to me, since its much thicker than a white wine. Im really enjoying the green apple & nut flavors. In addition its a very pleasing experience for the tiny japanophile part of my brain/soul :)

350 ml green bottle labeled Yamahai Muroka Junmai. Batch: 001. Bottled 29.04.2010. Kept refrigerated from receival about a year ago. Pours clear, pale straw golden. Alcohol and sweet, spiced rice on the nose. Sweet, alcoholic, light bitter and light acidic. Alcoholic warmth. Medium body and light syrupy like a white wine. Quite nice, compared to the few sake I had in my time. And quite nice in itself.
Enjoyed at home with home made sushi - in my book a really good match. 110924

Draft @ Delirium, Brussels, 10-09-2011.
Bon, ma première expérience avec avec un saké ci ce nest un éventuel verre à un resto japonais.
Tout comme un cidre, difficile à évaluer.
Doré avec fine opacité, le tout présentant pas de col.
Arôme de riz fermenté léger avec une pointe de pomme.
En bouche; doux allant sur un style vin blanc sec, le tout ayant une fine note de pomme et une amertume moyenne. Note de levure fermentée avec riz, le tout rappelle plus un vin blanc sec. Un saké, simple, bien fait, mais dans lequel je reste un novice.
Bottled. A light yellow sake. The aroma has notes of rice, lemons, cedar wood, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of rice lemons, and cedar wood.
On tap at Delirium. Clear with no head. Rice nose. Very alcy. Smooth texture but quite strong and unbalanced, in my opinon, as a Nogne lover.

Draft @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Pours a clear color with no head. Has a fruity sweetish yeasty rice aroma. Sweetish dry and slightly bitter rice flavor with weak apple hints. Has a sweetish fruity yeasty rice finish.
Københavnske Øldage 2011. Pours a clear colourless. Sweet with a very light sourness. Very light aromas of dates and apples. Hints of residual sugars. Light bodied.
My first Sake. Pours pale yellow with no head. Aroma is fruit, flower and alcohol. Flavour is heavy alcohol, fruit and flower.
Pale yellow with no head. Aroma of alcohol, boiled rice and vineous dried fruit. Sweet, alcohol and rice flavour
Clear colour. Rice herby alco aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Alco rice herbish sweet flavour, unbalanced and bit unpleasant.

Sampled at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Pours a very pale and yellowish sake with no head. The aroma is fruit, alcohol and flowers. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is alcoholwarmth. Overall an average sake.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Clear pale yellowish color, no head. Aroma of rice, bit spicy. Alcoholic, acidic, very dry taste. I have no clue if this is a decent example of a sake, as it is the very first one I tasted. Just funny to have a sake in my style collection. Not really my kind of brew, so my rating aint worth anything actually.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ BF 2011. Very pale yellowish colour, no head. Aroma is mild fruits, rice, some slight alcohol as well as mild yeastyness. Flavour is alcohol, rice, some grains and mild fruityness as well. Quite a pleasant Sake.

Tap @ Ølfestival 2011.
Pours clear, pale golden with no head. Aroma of boiled rice and sharp alcohol. Oily and sharp palate. Flavour is sharp, pure alcohol. Nothing for me.
Clear very pale yellow without head. Aroma is sweet, rice, green apples and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. A little watery with an alcoholic finish. My first saké. 260511
CBS;sweet aroma,pale, clear, none foam,medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, radiser,nice sake.
Sampled at CBF 2011. Colour is light yellow-green, no head. Aroma is fatty, sweet. Flavor is nice, sweet, alcohol, radise. Texture is syrupy, warming alcohol.
Draught at København ØLfestival 2011. Clear light yellow - no head. Rice, cedar tree notes, wooden, fruity notes, minerals, bitterness, alcoholic.
Pale yellow unclear colour. Moderate marcipan aroma. Average marcipan flavor. Long finish. Oily palate. Deasent sake.
Bottle. 1 year old. Pale yellow liquid. Nice aroma with strong alcohol note. Tastes strongly of white bread and starch. Some white wine and grapes up front but more potato in the finish.

almost clear white , no head.
sweet flowery rice aroma, quite dry.
flavor is rice,  flowers, dry. well balanced.
35 cL bottle. Pours colourless and with no head. Aroma is rice and slight wooden and mild fruity. Sweet rice, fruity and light alcohol presence. Alcohol and rice finish

Bottle 35 cl. Courtesy of yngwie. Pours almost crystal clear with a vague tint of yellow. Sweet rice aroma. Solid body, sweet rice, yeasty and somewhat phenollic, rather tired mouthfeel. Heavily boozy finish. Somewhat rough and unsophisticated. 100511

Bottle shared at The Trappist.  About as clear as you can get without much color to it at all.  Rice and hints of nuts on the aroma along with booze.  The flavor is mildly sweet and mildly nutty in addition to the rice you expect, with moderate alcohol.  Medium-light body with good crispness.  Not my favorite of Nøgne Øs sakes, but not bad.

looks like hazy lemonade, quite cloudy
smells like tinned, shredded pineapple
a tad sour tasting
nose is some vegetable, maybe leek or cabbage
UPDATED: APR 11, 2015 Bottle.Pours clear with no head.Aroma of rice and alcohol with hints of caramel, green bananas , rice and marzipan.Flavor is warming and sweet .Medium body, no carbonation.
Sampled at Carigs house. Almost clear liquid. Also quite a light taste, not too much of anything.
Bottle @ Southern/Western Denmark Tasting, Ulfborg. Pours clear no color. Nose is sweet. Rice, honey, herbs and alcohol. Very sticky. Had much worse . . Close to being drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2015 Bottle 350ml @ yngwie
Pours almost clear as water with no head. Aroma has notes of rice, alcohol, and some fruitiness. Taste is light to medium sweet with a long warm, fruity and rice finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, no carbonation

Bottle 350ml @ fonefan
Pours clear as water with no head. Aroma has notes of rice and alcohol. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Texture is oily with soft carbonation. [5 1 5 2 8 = 2.1 12/14/2010]

Bottle 350ml. [ As Yamahai Muroka Junmai-Shu Sake ].Clear cristal water color with virtaully none head. Aroma is moderate rice, earthy rice, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and a sharp acidic - fruity notes with a long duration, rice, earthy rice, sharp alcohol. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20101211]

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 bottle at home .. huge thanks to the Brewer for bringing these to MUSA... quite yellow .. nice light viscous ... nice clean rich earth rice nose ... quite nice aroma ... light acohol in nose .. open alcohol front  ... light tartness ... soft earth rise ... light raw green alcohol... very drinkable...  tk2 light yellow hint ... rich deep earthy coconut tones ... definitly like the smell ... little aniseed nose ... soft fruits ... earthy ... light coconut... light alcohol... quite like this but the nose excels 3.7

bottle at home ... thanks to Sevare ... light yellow ... soft earthy deep rice nose ... big pineapple front ... hints of coconut ... ligth raw alcohol ... fruity ... nice soft fruity rice  3.8
Bottle, 16%. Weak alcohol and fruity air aroma. Clear colour, almost like water. The flavour is alcoholic with some herbal distilled fruit notes. Tastes like any other sake to me.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 Bottle. Clear as water with no head. Flavour is rise, alcohol, dry, little sweet and almonds.
Bottle at fonefan tasting. No head. Color is pale as water. Aroma and taste are almonds, rice and alcohol.

Small coarseish foam disappears immediately. Hazy nearly clear greenish body. Fruity mineraly sugary aroma with alcohol and oil notes. Dry-sweet alcoholic herbal fruity taste with grape notes. Mid-bodied. Sharpish mouthfeel initially, then intensely hot at the end. Dryish mineraly fruity aftertaste is sort of faint. Well. Its not at all bad, but theres just way too much in-your-face alcohol for me. (0.35l bottle, wine monopoly.)

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2012 Bottle. Its a clear, slightly yellowish sake, flat and headless. Theres some booze on the nose, some citric acidity too, its quite fruity and with a sort of pleasant rice aroma. The flavor has a certain acidity, with rice and fruityness in a quite pleasant blend. Warming, medium to full body and dry, finishing with fruits and rice. A rather nice one, but I have to admit I have a long way to go to fully appreciate sake. Rating: 6-3-6-3-12-3.0. 100611Bottle, #015. A clear, lighlty yellowish sake, lightly oily pours. Apples, melon, a generic fruityness, hints of alcohol and a faint note of rice. Oily, full-bodied and warming in the mouth. Lots of fruityness, some alcohol notes and a touch of cooked rice. Lasting finish. Certainly an improved edition of Junmai-Shu. 121126
Bottle. Clear white colour with no head. Aroma is alcohol, fruit, floral, rice. Flavour is alcohol, fruit, yeast, floral, rice.  OK sake

350 ml bottle. Clear, pale straw colored body. Aroma is quite mild, but pleasant. Floral, rice and light fruity. Flavor has a mild fruitiness, slightly spicy and smooth alcoholic with a touch of fruity acidity. The alcohol is surprisingly well hidden.  I think I could get used to this.

Bottle, from Vinmonopolets web shop. My first thought is: how come Im rater no. 3 on this sake? Its been around since the summer now; are people really that "beerservative" that they dont support our best microbrewerys attempt at branching out? I sure as hell do, despite the fact that I dont really have a very good track record for sake and still consider my self as acquiring the taste... Pours a pale, clear straw yellow body. Nose is starched rice, alcohol and hints of honey and almonds. Taste is surprisingly mild; at first I dont feel a thing. Then, slowly at first, comes a warming alcohol feel accompanied by subtle flavors of rice, smooth yeasty tones and some nuttiness that I cant quite put my finger on. This is actually surprisingly nice; not in a flavor-rich kinda way but in the lightness and subtlety of the palate and aromatic profile. Still, Im not totally sold on sake yet, but this is by far one of the best Ive had.

Bottle at Olympen, ABV 16%, nihonshudo -4. Pale straw colour. Herbal with typical ricey(!) junmai character. Aniseed, herbs, good spiciness towards the finish. Good sweet and dry balance, quite subtle.
Bottle, courtesy of Nøgne Ø. Very pale straw coloured sake, no head nor carbonation. Filtered and pasteurised. Strong sweetish aroma of marzipan and almonds. Sweetish flavour, rice, marzipan. Dull.
